column5: United Continental Holdings Inc said on Monday it expects to take delivery of two used Boeing Co 737-700 aircraft this month  which were formerly operated by Copa Holdings SA's Copa Airlines.

column4: Verizon offers hikes to 38 000 employees after starting union negotiations
column5: Verizon Communications Inc  said it offered salary hikes to 38 000 employee in its East wireline business after its first negotiating session with representatives of the Communications Workers of America and the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers.

column4: Green Dot renews agreement stay as Wal-Mart's MoneyCard issuer
column5: June 22 Green Dot Corp  a U.S. issuer of prepaid MasterCard and Visa cards  said it renewed an agreement which would keep it as the issuing bank for Wal-Mart Stores Inc's prepaid reloadable debit cards for five years.

column4: Energy Transfer offer may be Williams' best option -analysts
column5: HOUSTON  June 22 Energy Transfer Equity's  unsolicited $48 billion offer for Williams Companies Inc  through a corporate structure with tax advantages may be the U.S. pipeline company's best option as potential bids from rivals are complicated by possible antitrust issues and the deal's rich price  investors and analysts said on Monday.

column4: Deals of the day- Mergers and acquisitions
column5: June 22 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2000 GMT on Monday:

column4: ETE confirms $48 billion bid for reluctant Williams Co
column5: Energy Transfer Equity LP confirmed it had made a $48 billion unsolicited bid for natural gas pipeline company Williams Companies Inc  hours after Williams rejected the offer as significantly too low.

column4: UPDATE 1-ETE confirms $48 bln bid for reluctant Williams Co
column5: June 22 Energy Transfer Equity LP  confirmed it had made a $48 billion unsolicited bid for natural gas pipeline company Williams Companies Inc  hours after Williams rejected the offer as significantly too low.

column4: Energy Transfer Equity confirms bid for Williams Co
column5: Energy Transfer Equity LP  a portfolio company that owns energy assets  said it has made an all-equity offer of $53.1 billion  including debt  to merge with Williams Companies Inc.

column4: Energy Transfer Equity confirms bid for Williams Co
column5: June 22 Energy Transfer Equity LP  a portfolio company that owns energy assets  said it has made an all-equity offer of $53.1 billion  including debt  to merge with Williams Companies Inc.

column4: UPDATE 2-Williams Co rejects $48 bln unsolicited offer
column5: June 21 Natural gas pipeline company Williams Companies Inc said on Sunday it is exploring strategic options after it received an unsolicited takeover proposal for $64 per share or $48 billion.
